settings.title: PRODUCT CARE
settings.content:
Jo Mercer is committed to quality, driven by design and unparalleled in fit.
Our shoes and bags are crafted from high quality materials sourced from
around the globe, understanding how to care for you Jo Mercer pieces
makes your purchase look it’s best for longer.

settings.title: LEATHER
settings.answer: To protect your leather shoes apply the All Protector Spray or Zanolin before wear. Please cover any embellishments, jewels and trims when during application. After your initial period of wear, leather will provide you with a superior fit, to replenish and maintain your leather shoes apply Zanolin, Rain guard Cream or Polish. All leather gives with wear.

settings.title: PATENT LEATHER
settings.answer: Patent leather shoes can also be cared for using Zanolin before wear. We also recommend using the Super Shine Sponge to replenish and maintain their high shine finish. Patent leather should be kept away from other patent leathers or plastics and should be cleaned only with Zanolin patent leather cleaner.

settings.title: METALLIC LEATHER, BEADS + TRIMS
settings.answer: Embellished and metallic Jo Mercer shoes are crafted using high quality leather, trims and other embellishments, all of which are attached and secured with care. Please take extra care when wearing and storing your shoes. For the best protection, apply the Neutral Metallic Rainguard Cream before wear. For Suede and Nubuck metallic shoes apply All Protector Spray, ensuring to cover any embellishments and trims.

settings.title: FABRIC, SUEDE + NUBUCK
settings.answer:
To assist with any water damage or marks use the Tana Suede & Nubuck Brush. Please cover any embellishments, jewels and trims when applying the All Protector Spray.

Suede and Nubuck leathers will maintain their appearance when worn in dry conditions, please wear with care.

settings.title: PONY HAIR
settings.answer: To protect and maintain your pony hair leather shoes, apply the All Protector Spray and use the Medium Shoe Brush.

settings.title: HEEL TIPS + SOLES
settings.answer: Heel tips can separate from shoes from time to time from normal wear and should be replaced as soon as possible before the wear affects the heel. Jo Mercer shoes feature either a rubber or resin sole, and generally will not require resoling. This excludes cases of excessive wear. These soles do not absorb water and are crafted with a high attention to detail.

settings.title: ESPADRILLES
settings.answer: Espadrilles will maintain their appearance when worn in dry conditions, please wear with care.

settings.title: INNER SOLE
settings.answer: Each of our soles are fitted with soft foam padding, which creates a memory fitting effect after repeated wear. They are finished in a fresh neutral shade or soft black with the signature Jo Mercer logo. Inner soles may separate or lift from time to time with normal wear. This is something that can be easily repaired by a shoe repairer.

settings.title: CAMPOMAGGI BAGS
settings.answer: The Campomaggi range explores the use of high-quality leathers combined with rustic textural features and metal details to create unique and exclusive accessories. Campomaggi epitomizes timeless design and quality craftmanship, all products are hand-made in Italy and enrich over time. Campomaggi uses resistant cow-hide leather, a refined type of leather that reveals natural textures and irregularities. Natural cow-hide, over time, gains beauty and shine. Each Campomaggi bag will contain a Cream Kit that will help you protect your bag from external agents and safeguard it’s softness.

settings.text: Jo Mercer is committed to quality, driven by design and unparalleled in fit. Our shoes and bags are crafted from high quality materials sourced from around the globe, understanding how to care for you Jo Mercer pieces makes your purchase look it’s best for longer.Taking care of your shoes not only preserves their appearance but also extends their lifespan, ensuring comfort and functionality over time. Here’s a guide covering various aspects of shoe care.

settings.title: Shoe Life
settings.answer: Rotate between different pairs of shoes to allow each pair to rest and air out. This prevents excessive wear and tear and helps maintain the shape and integrity of the shoes. Giving shoes a break between wears allows moisture absorbed during the day to evaporate, which helps prevent odour buildup and prolongs the life of the materials.

settings.title: Shoe Shape Maintenance
settings.answer: Insert shoe trees into your shoes when they are not being worn. Choose cedar shoe trees for their ability to absorb moisture and maintain the shape of leather shoes, preventing wrinkles and creases. If shoe trees are not available, stuff shoes with acid-free tissue paper or cloth to help them maintain their form. This is particularly useful for delicate or soft-leather shoes that may lose shape over time.

settings.title: Storage Techniques
settings.answer: Store shoes in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight and humidity. Excessive heat and moisture can cause leather to crack or mould to develop. Use cloth or breathable shoe bags to protect shoes from dust while allowing air circulation. This prevents the buildup of moisture that can lead to odour and deterioration of materials.

settings.title: Odour Maintenance
settings.answer: Immediately after wearing, remove the shoes and place them in a well-ventilated area to dry out naturally. This helps prevent bacteria growth and reduces odor. Consider using removable insoles that can be washed or replaced periodically to maintain freshness.

settings.title: Worn soles
settings.answer: Regularly inspect the soles of your shoes for signs of wear and tear, such as thinning tread or cracks. Promptly replacing worn-out soles can prevent discomfort and further damage to the shoe's structure. If your soles need to be replaced or repaired, consult a cobbler or shoe repairer.

settings.title: White Sneakers Care Tip
settings.answer: Clean your white leather sneakers regularly using a leather cleaner such as Zanolin or cloth with a mixture of mild soap and water. Gently scrub away dirt and stains, focusing on areas like the sole and laces. Avoid drying white sneakers in direct sunlight, as this can cause yellowing. Instead, let them air dry naturally in a shaded area or use a fan to speed up the drying process.

settings.title: Leather
settings.answer: After the initial wear, your leather shoes will mould to the shape of your feet, ensuring a superior fit. All leather will naturally give slightly with wear. To protect your leather shoes, apply All Protector Spray or Zanolin before use. Be sure to cover any embellishments, jewels, and trims during application. Additionally, using Zanolin, Rain Guard Cream, or Polish will help replenish and maintain the quality of your leather shoes.

settings.title: Patent Leather
settings.answer:
Handle patent leather with care to maintain its longevity and pristine appearance.
Keep patent leather items separate from other patent leathers or plastics to prevent marking. Apply Zanolin before wearing to protect your shoes, and use the Super Shine Sponge regularly to preserve their glossy finish. Clean exclusively with a specialised cleaner such as Zanolin patent leather cleaner.

settings.title: Nubuck + Suede
settings.answer: To prolong the life of your suede and nubuck shoes, keep them away from moisture and direct sunlight. Excess colour may remain in the leather, so avoid contact with light-coloured garments, accessories, and upholstery. To refresh the appearance of your product, lightly brush the surface with the Tana Suede & Nubuck Brush using circular motions.

settings.title: Metallic
settings.answer: Metallic foils are fused to high-quality leather hides, creating luxurious finishes. Due to the nature of these materials, the surface may be susceptible to scuffing and some fading over time. For optimal protection, apply Neutral Metallic Rainguard Cream before wear. For suede and nubuck metallic leathers, use theAll Protector Spray.

settings.title: Hair on leathers
settings.answer: Due to the nature of ‘hair on’ leathers, the hair fibres may wear off over time. To prologue the life of your item, keep away from moisture and direct sunlight. Apply the All Protector Spray to help repel stains. When needed, gently brush in the direction of the hair using the Medium Shoe Brush.

settings.title: Espadrilles
settings.answer: Espadrilles are crafted with layers of natural jute braid, known for its durability and rustic charm. Best suited for dry conditions, these shoes should be worn with care to maintain their appearance. Moisture can weaken the jute fibers, so avoid wet conditions. For added protection, consider applying a fabric protector spray to the jute and canvas portions. If they do get wet, allow them to air dry naturally.

settings.title: Natural Raffia, Jute & Straw
settings.answer: Raffia, Jute, and Straw are natural materials, that require a little extra care to keep them looking good. Keep away from moisture and direct heat. Regularly dust with a soft brush or dry cloth, and spot clean with a slightly damp cloth, letting them air dry. Store in a cool, dry place with shoe trees or tissue paper, and use a dust bag to prevent dust accumulation. Avoid rough surfaces to prevent fraying, and trim any loose fibers to keep the items looking neat.

settings.title: Textiles
settings.answer:
To care for your textile bags and shoes, keep away from dirt, moisture and direct heat. 

Maintain by regularly dusting off with a clean, soft brush to remove surface dirt. Spot clean stains with a damp cloth and mild detergent and allow to air dry completely. To help maintain their shape, use shoe trees or stuff them with tissue paper. Store in a cool, dry place in breathable fabric bags to prevent dust accumulation and allow air circulation.

settings.title: Beads, Trims & Embellishments
settings.answer: Embellished Jo Mercer shoes are crafted using high quality trims and decorations, all of which are attached and secured with care. Please take extra care when wearing and storing your shoes to avoid losing trims or catching on clothing.

settings.title: Heel Tips
settings.answer: Heel tips can occasionally separate from shoes with normal wear and should be replaced promptly to prevent damage to the heel.

settings.title: Outsoles
settings.answer: Jo Mercer shoes feature either rubber or resin soles, which generally do not require resoling except in cases of excessive wear. These soles do not absorb water and maintain a reliable grip.
